newsitem.title: UK: London gold price up on Dutch gold sales news.
newsitem.headline: London gold price up on Dutch gold sales news.

text.p: Gold prices moved slightly higher on Monday after news that the Dutch central bank said it had sold 300 tonnes of gold "recently".
Prices were last indicated at $359.60/$370.10 an ounce, compared to Friday's London close of $358.85/$359.35.
Fears that one or more of the European central banks had sold some gold reserves had contributed to a dramatic fall in bullion prices decline to 3-1/4 year lows in recent weeks.
"The news is probably bullish short term and bearish long term," said bullion analyst Andy Smith of Union Bank of Switzerland. "People are probably buying the volatility."
